page.title: 19CORSHAM CRICKET CLUB
page.content: Corsham Cricket Club is the oldest sports club in the town.It was founded in 1848 on land belonging to the Methuen family. Lord Methuen is now the president. Before it was a cricket field it was Corsham common in the centre of the town used for the annual horse fair. The cricket season would not start until after the hay making. The famous cricketer W.G. Grace played on the ground when he captained the local village team of Marshfield against Corsham. The present club has 50 senior members and 25 juniors some of them who played for the county. They run 2 senior teams an under 13 teams and an under 15 team. The 1st XI have had a successful season and have reached the final of the Wiltshire senior cup.Every August the Cricket Club have a one week Cricket tour in the Portsmouth area.
